title: JUST IN: One of two men shot in Belle Glade has died, sheriff says
content:
9:30 a.m. UPDATE: The homicide was the fourth in Palm Beach County during 2017 and the first in the Glades since Nov. 29, when Matthew Vereen was found slain at Southwest Sixth Avenue and Martin Luther King Boulevard in Belle Glade.
9 a.m. UPDATE: A man who was shot in Belle Glade late Monday has died, the Palm Beach County Sheriff’s Office said.
The other male who was shot, a juvenile, is in critical condition.
Original post: Police are still looking for a suspect after two men were shot in Belle Glade Monday night, according to the Palm Beach County Sheriff’s Office.
Deputies responded to reports of a shooting on the 100 block of State Road 715 around 9:45 p.m. and found two men with gunshot wounds.
They were taken to hospital for treatment, but information about their condition was not immediately available.
PBSO spokeswoman Teri Barbera said deputies were as yet unable to determine a motive or suspect for the shooting.
Anyone with information can contact Crime Stoppers at 1-800-458-TIPS.
